events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on a busy downtown street causing severe damage to the front bumper and hood of the vehicle.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after confirming keywords related to vehicle and collision from the initial report.
An agent specialized in auto insurance claims is assigned to handle the customer’s file and coordinate further investigations.
The claim has been formally acknowledged and the customer has been informed that their case is under review.
Request sent to the customer for submitting the vehicle photos, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and detailed repair estimates for the damaged vehicle.
An investigation has started to evaluate the validity and extent of damages claimed from the auto accident.
Investigation was successfully completed confirming the legitimacy of the accident and estimated repair costs.
A settlement amount has been proposed to the customer based on the findings of the investigation and repair costs.
Customer provided positive feedback regarding the efficient handling of their auto accident claim and the proposed settlement.
Claim has been approved by the claims department authorizing the release of settlement payment to the customer.
Payment for the approved claim was issued and sent to the customer’s registered bank account promptly.
The auto accident claim has been successfully closed after payment issuance and confirmation of customer satisfaction.
All records and documents related to this auto accident claim have been archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
